intro: Euodia glomerata, commonly known as the clustered sandstone apple, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. Euodia glomerata thrives in sandy soils and is often found in coastal and semi-arid regions. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species.
